specials.name: Sneak Attack
specials.description: If a target is flat footed against the nekomata's strike, then that strike does 1d6 additional precision damage.

specials.name: End the Charade
specials.description: Trigger The nekomata is transformed with its shape change ability and another creature moves adjacent to it or takes a hostile action against it. Effect The nekomata reverts to its natural form and can make a Strike against the triggering creature. If the creature was unaware the nekomata was in disguise, that creature is flat-footed against this attack.

specials.name: Nekomata Madness
specials.description: The fatigued, stupefied and confused conditions of Nekomata Madness can not be removed until it is cured; Saving Throw DC 25 Fortitude; Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day); Stage 2 Fatigued (1 day); Stage 3: Stupefied 2 (1 day); Stage 4; Confused.

specials.name: Change Shape
specials.description: The nekomata takes on the specific appearance of any Medium or smaller humanoid or feline  who it has seen and whose appearance it remembers. This doesn’t change the nekomata’s Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).  Without it’s perfect copy ability, a nekomata relies on the outcome of an Impersonate (Deception) roll to take on the form of a specific creature.

specials.name: Perfect Copy
specials.description: A nekomata is able to perfectly copy the mannerisms and appearance of the last creature that it struck with its Strike (Bite).

specials.name: Create Undead
specials.description: Up to three times per day, a nekomata can turn a dead body into an undead creature by licking it. A skeleton rises as a skeletal champion, while a body with flesh animates as a juju zombie.  Undead created in this way are free-willed.
